meaningMnemonic: They <radical>say</radical> the <radical>key</radical> to telling a <kanji>lie</kanji> is to totally believe the lie yourself. They say that if you believe your own lie, others will believe it as well. This is key.
readingMnemonic: The <kanji>lie</kanji> you told was about not stealing your buddy’s <reading>saw</reading> (さ). You actually did steal his saw. He saw you steal his saw, but now you are trying to lie your way out of it. It’s not going well.
